profileText: A Representative from Montana; born in Grand Rapids, Minn., December 30, 1946; graduated from Aitkin High School, Aitkin, Minn., 1964; B.A., Saint Cloud State University, 1968; J.D., Concord School of Law, Los Angeles, Calif., 2005; proprietor, surety bonding business; Republican precinct committeeman and state committeeman from Lewis and Clark County; member, board of directors, Montana Science and Technology Alliance; chair, State Worker's Compensation Board, 1993-1996; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Fifth Congress and One Hundred Sixth Congresses (January 3, 1997-January 3, 2001); was not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Seventh Congress in 2000; unsuccessful candidate for Governor of Montana in 2012; is a resident of Helena, Mont.

researchRecord.name: 1997-2000, 58 linear feet.
researchRecord.description: The collection consists of papers created and collected by Representative Rick Hill in his service as a congressman from Montana from 1997 to 2000. The collection includes constituent correspondence (1997-2000); subject files (1997-2000) relating to legislative processes, national issues, and Montana-specific issues; press releases (1997-2000); and form letters (1997-2000).
